column4: I've installed nvidia-173 and I'm still not getting hardware acceleration on my geforce9400m
I had the same thing and could never get it working
Got ATI now and got it working, but I like everything else about nvidia in linux better
if you figure it out please please let me know, I've still got the card
what exactly was your issue, and what card was it?
just could never get hardware acceleration working
I think GTX 570? Id have to go downstairs and look, also can't get it working with the cuda or whatever is in my notebook
ya, tried with the download, and both options avail within ubuntu, and multiple different suggestions for xorg conf
Did you uninstall Nouveau, the NV display driver, and run nvidia-xconfig?

finally put this older radeon in the desktop and got it working no prob, which is fine since that is what I mostly use the desktop for, but I'd rather use the nvidia and get it working on my notebook as well
are nv and nouveau not the same thing?
trying to remember which one I tried if they are different, I believe I tried nouveau
NV is just a display driver, Nouveau is an experimental opensource Nvidia driver with 2d acceleration and very little 3d acceleration
Don't use Nouveau, you can expect the project to have hardware acceleration done by the time robots rule the earth.

i think the answer is yes then, actually im fairly certain i somehow got NV, but it presents itself as nouveau at readout, maybe i got them together somehow? who knows its been a while now. I do know that I scoured the earth to get it working and never did
didnt try that hard with the quadro in my notebook though, perhaps I should

Yeah Nv is the default driver for nvidia cards, you should uninstall that when you install your proprietary nvidia driver. Once you're done run nvidia-xconfig because anytime you install/uninstall any package related to xorg, your xorg.conf changes
